title: Understanding SQL SELECT Syntax
text: The SQL SELECT statement is used to query and retrieve data from databases. The order in which you specify the columns determines the order they will appear in the result set.

hintAnswer: A will appear first, followed by B.
title: Checking Column Order
text: If you write `SELECT A, B FROM table`, which column should appear first in the results?
choices: A will appear first, followed by B.
B will appear first, followed by A.

title: Query Output Comparison
text: Compare the order of columns specified in the SQL query with the order of columns expected in the result set. Remember, SQL queries retrieve columns in the order they are specified.

hintAnswer: Query 1: Street, ZIP; Query 2: ZIP, Street
title: Analyzing Query $$1$$ and Query $$2$$
text: In Query $$1$$, Street is listed before ZIP in the SELECT statement. In Query $$2$$, ZIP is listed before Street. How should the columns appear for each query?
choices: Query 1: ZIP, Street; Query 2: Street, ZIP
Query 1: Street, ZIP; Query 2: ZIP, Street
Both queries show the same result set.
